question_text: What enables DDR memory to achieve higher transfer rates than SDR memory?
answer_options: It runs at a lower voltage
It has fewer pins and smaller size
It transfers data on both edges of the clock cycle
It uses cache memory to reduce latency
correct_answer: It transfers data on both edges of the clock cycle
explanation: DDR (Double Data Rate) memory improves on SDR by transferring data on both the rising and falling edges of the clock cycle, doubling throughput without increasing clock speed.
